meanings.definition: The act of preying upon or plundering
meanings.sent1: The depredation of the lion on the herd of antelope was swift and merciless.
meanings.sent2: The depredation of the pirates on the merchant ships caused great loss.
meanings.sent3: The depredation of the raccoons on the cornfield left the farmer scratching his head.
meanings.sent4: The depredation of time on old buildings can be seen in the crumbling walls.
meanings.sent5: The depredation of the storm on the coastline was evident in the uprooted trees and eroded shore.

meanings.definition: The act of laying waste or destroying
meanings.sent1: The depredation of the wildfire on the forest was devastating.
meanings.sent2: The depredation of the vandals on the park benches left them in ruins.
meanings.sent3: The depredation of the toddler on the toy box scattered toys everywhere.
meanings.sent4: The depredation of neglect on the garden was evident in the overgrown weeds.
meanings.sent5: The depredation of the flood on the town caused widespread damage and destruction.

meanings.definition: The act of ravaging or pillaging
meanings.sent1: The depredation of the invaders on the village left it in ruins.
meanings.sent2: The depredation of the looters on the museum artifacts was a tragic loss.
meanings.sent3: The depredation of the kids on the candy store shelves was a sight to behold.
meanings.sent4: The depredation of greed on the land led to its desolation.
meanings.sent5: The depredation of war on the country's resources was immense and long-lasting.
